intro: Randia brenesii, commonly known as the Guatemalan randia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe. Randia brenesii is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
